meanings.definition: To scrape or wear away by friction or erosion.
meanings.sent1: The rough sandpaper will abrade the wood surface.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to abrade the delicate skin when scrubbing.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally abraded the paper while trying to erase a mistake.
meanings.sent4: The constant friction abrades the metal, revealing its true shine.
meanings.sent5: The river's strong currents abrade the rocks over time, shaping them into smooth pebbles.

meanings.definition: To rub or wear off the surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The rough cloth will abrade the paint off the wall.
meanings.sent2: If you keep rubbing the stain, you might abrade the fabric.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to abrade the label off the jar, it just happened.
meanings.sent4: The wind and sand can abrade the surface of the ancient statue.
meanings.sent5: The constant use of the eraser can abrade the pencil markings on the paper.

meanings.definition: To irritate or roughen by rubbing.
meanings.sent1: The tag on my shirt always abrades my neck and irritates it.
meanings.sent2: The rough edges of the box can abrade your skin if you're not careful.
meanings.sent3: The new shoes abraded my heels and caused blisters.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive motion of the tool can abrade the surface, making it rough.
meanings.sent5: The harsh scrubbing can abrade the surface of the table, making it look worn out.
